meanings.definition: A person who seizes or takes possession of something.
meanings.sent1: The seisers quickly grabbed the treasure chest.
meanings.sent2: The seisers claimed ownership of the abandoned house.
meanings.sent3: The seisers playfully snatched the last cookie from the jar.
meanings.sent4: The seisers were like hungry wolves pouncing on their prey.
meanings.sent5: The image of the seisers swooping in like eagles stayed in my mind.

meanings.definition: The act of seizing or taking possession of something.
meanings.sent1: The seisers of the stolen goods were caught by the police.
meanings.sent2: The seisers of power often face resistance from those they displace.
meanings.sent3: The seisers of the remote control led to a family feud over the TV.
meanings.sent4: The seisers of opportunity are usually the ones who succeed in life.
meanings.sent5: The seisers of the crown jewels made headlines around the world.
